image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: Former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn gave police a detailed description of his attempts to "disappear from the scene" of the deaths of two retirees he was later accused of murdering, a court has heard.

title.children: Murder accused covered up campers' deaths in bid for 'a normal life', court hears

image.altText: Northern Minerals

props.synopsis: An Australian company that runs a strategically crucial heavy rare earth project has been targeted in a suspected cyber attack just hours after Treasurer Jim Chalmers ordered Chinese investors be removed.

title.children: Rare earths miner targeted in suspected cyber attack following removal of Chinese investors

image.altText: Underworld figure Tony Mokbel is lead into a prison van at the Melbourne Supreme Court on October 18, 2011.

props.synopsis:
Immigration Minister Andrew Giles reveals he is considering whether to cancel the visa of a Melbourne gangland figure, who the Administrative Appeals Tribunal allowed to stay in the country just yesterday.

Â

title.children: Giles considering cancelling visa of alleged Tony Mokbel family associate

image.altText: An fake image, showing graffiti that doesn't actually exist superimposed onto a street in Paris.

props.synopsis: A pro-Russian campaign is targeting Australian news organisations, including the ABC, according to international researchers.

title.children: ABC and Australian news outlets are in the crosshairs of a pro-Russian influence operation

image.altText: Free range chickens at a farm in western Victoria.

props.synopsis: Farm Pride Foods announces the viral strain detected at its Lethbridge aviary site is "the same strain found on an egg farm at Meredith" around 10 days ago.

title.children: Third Victorian poultry farm declares bird flu outbreak

image.altText: Arthur Eaton main pic - cropped

props.synopsis: The Victorian Department of Education faces several lawsuits from survivors who were sexually abused by a teacher the department knowingly moved to other schools after fielding complaints of abuse.

title.children: Serial predator Arthur Eaton 'fooled' everyone with a guide dog puppy and almost became teacher of the year

image.altText: A woman looks on with her hands behind her head.

props.synopsis: Cortnee Vine is among four debutants in Australia's women's football team heading to Paris without seven-time Olympic goalscorer Sam Kerr.

title.children: Trailblazers, record breakers, debutants and no Sam Kerr: Matildas name their Paris Olympics team

image.altText: image of woolworth building at mooroopna

props.synopsis: Shepparton man Matthew Atkinson has been sentenced to jail with a non-parole period of three years and six months for a fatal assault in Mooroopna last year where he punched and stomped on Mr Delphine's head twice.

title.children: 20yo sentenced to six years jail for fatal assault on Mooroopna man Bjorn Delphine at supermarket

image.altText: Man takes cash from ATM

props.synopsis: NDIS participants have been forced to hand over cash for criminals to buy drugs, and later harassed by the fraudulent providers.Â

title.children: How criminals are rorting NDIS participants for drug trafficking

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tam biscuits on a shelf, with a price tag saying $11.70

props.synopsis: The cost of living has increased more sharply in regional areas than in the cities, with some outback residents paying double for essential goods like food and fuel. Now the federal government is coming up with a plan to try to level the playing field, but will it work?Â

title.children: Is this Australia's most expensive town? Tim Tams cost $11.70 a packet or more than $1 a biscuit

image.altText: A woman in military uniform looks through a pair of binoculars on the deck of a ship.

props.synopsis: Foreign citizens living permanently in Australia will soon be able to serve in Australia's armed forces, as part of an effort to boost sluggish recruitment.

title.children: Foreign citizens with permanent residency to be allowed to join the Australian Defence Force

image.altText: A large white cruise ship is parked at a berth.

props.synopsis: The Australian travel brand will fold its operations into parent company Carnival Cruise Line from March 2025, leaving passengers with cruises booked on the Pacific Explorer after that date to receive a refund or credit.

title.children: P&O Cruises Australia to shut its doors after 90 years, leaving Pacific Explorer to be retired

image.altText: A tornado

props.synopsis: A man who has pleaded not guilty to dozens of charges denies he told storm victims he held a builder's licence.Â

title.children: Man accused of defrauding couple who lost home in NSW tornado faces court

image.altText: Ali Syed walks down a busy street

props.synopsis: From higher education to fast food, Legal Aid says wage theft is "everywhere" in Australia.Â

title.children: Wage theft is 'part of Australia's work culture', legal groups say. Now workers are fighting back

image.altText: Bill Shorten mid-sentence wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Frontbencher Bill Shorten says he has nothing to do with negotiating the contracts of departmental speechwriters, denying any link to an employee's $600,000 contract to provide speeches across his portfolios.

title.children: 'If you're trying to link me, good luck': Shorten denies any involvement in speechwriter's $300k payday

image.altText: Andrew Cobby sits in the back of a police car.

props.synopsis: Andrew Cobby, who was found guilty of murdering his wife, says he should be granted an appeal after "dramatic" changes to DNA were uncovered in a review.

title.children: Andrew Cobby challenges murder conviction over DNA lab bungle

image.altText: Man and woman clapping as crowd hold small French flags.

props.synopsis: Gabriel Attal makes a surprise appearance at a radio debate next to fellow party member Valery Hayer, leading to accusations of mansplaining or "manterrupting".

title.children: French prime minister accused of mansplaining after surprise debate appearance

image.altText: A man presses his hands together in prayer

props.synopsis: India's election has been a Herculean exercise involving 15 million polling officials and security personnel, 1 million polling stations, more than 8,000 candidates and 744 political parties. Here's what to expect next.

title.children: Sent by God': Narendra Modi concludes a 45-hour meditation as he awaits a verdict on his decade in power

image.altText: A smiling young man with short, dark hair sits with his back to a bushy valley.

props.synopsis: Kye Schaefer, 21, died early last month in Coffs Harbour. A 36-year-old man has been charged with murder has faced court.Â

title.children: Murder charge laid after young surfer found stabbed in beachside car park

image.altText: John Todd and a Swan Districts player are carried on shoulders above a crowd of fans as the team celebrates a WAFL premiership.

props.synopsis: John Todd, one of the most influential figures in WA football history, dies at the age of 86.

title.children: John Todd, WA football giant and former Eagles coach, dies aged 86

image.altText: Dustin Martin dishes off a handball

props.synopsis: Dustin Martin will miss Thursday night's clash against the Crows, but the injury-hit Tigers could welcome back a powerful midfield duo.Â

title.children: 'He's a bit crook': Richmond's Dustin Martin rested ahead of milestone match at MCG

image.altText: De Minaur kid

props.synopsis: The unlikely bond between Australia's rising tennis star and a French kid in the crowd made global headlines â and Alex de Minaur wants his young mascot courtside for the rest of his run.

title.children: With his French super fan by his side, Alex de Minaur is winning hearts and minds in Paris

image.altText: Kim looks longingly into the sky from his farm. On the left is another picture of water sloshing around.

props.synopsis: For decades multinational companies like Coca-Cola have been taking water out of the ground for free and bottling it up to sell. A small Perth community is a microcosm of the debate about whether that should continue.

title.children: 'Taking water away': As these Australians battle drought, multinationals have been doing as they please

image.altText: An aerial shot of Reef HQ aquarium in Townsville where a coral reef can be seen surrounded by buildings.

props.synopsis: Australia's Reef Authority had $80 million to repair and refurbish its showpiece aquarium in Townsville, but scrapped the project for a grander design it knew it could not pay for.

title.children: World's largest living coral reef exhibit closed indefinitely

image.altText: Man leaning on balcony railing with coffee cup, looking out to sea, small wallaby marsupial behind him, coastal background

props.synopsis: Ron Taylor lives most of the year wandering around his island home in solitude, living off-grid away from the pressures of the rat race. It's a "great lifestyle".

title.children: Ron could be a modern-day Gilligan living on his isolated island. But he has no desire to be rescued

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: A forensic scientist says the DNA of two people â Toyah Cordingley and an unknown person â was found on the young woman's fingernail clippings.

title.children: DNA of 'unknown' person found under murdered woman's fingernails, court hears

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a microphone in Congress while a red-haired boy makes a funny face behind him.

props.synopsis: A mischievous six-year-old has gone viral for upstaging his congressman dad in the US House of Representatives.

title.children: US politician's son goes viral for making funny faces at camera as dad delivers speech

image.altText: A woman soccer player is wrapped in a large cloak made of kangaroo skin by a famous Aboriginal sports icon

props.synopsis: As the Matildas' longest-serving goalkeeper and proud Noongar woman, Lydia Williams has ushered through a new era of Australian sport, both on and off the field.

title.children: 'It's everything': Lydia Williams leaves the Matildas as one of its greatest legacies

image.altText: Light brown French bulldog puppy lying on bright yellow floor.

props.synopsis: Australia has one of the highest pet ownership rates in the world. But are we being the best pet parents possible? Or do we need to rethink how we breed, buy and care for our animals?

title.children: Designer pets are all the rage, but they carry a 'sinister legacy'

image.altText: A close-up of Hunter Biden's face. He is wearing a suit, tie and American flag pin.

props.synopsis: Just days after a New York jury convicted Donald Trump in his criminal trial, Joe Biden's son is going on trial in a court in Delaware. Here's the case against him, explained.

title.children: As the president's son goes on trial, Biden family drama is likely to be aired in court

image.altText: Aerial shot of massive oil and gas rig in the Bass Strait off Victoria

props.synopsis: The company behind one of Australia's largest sources of oil and gas is planning the removal of about half of its platforms, but environmental groups are concerned it will create a toxic dump in Corner Inlet's wetland.Â

title.children: Old oil and gas rigs in Bass Strait to be decommissioned, but what does it mean for the environment?

image.altText: A man stands in front of red and green indicator boards.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has lost some ground after heavy falls in oil and iron ore prices and a mixed performance on Wall Street. Follow live.

title.children: ASX loses ground as oil and iron ore prices slump

Real estate listings surge in May but property market 'normal' and 'unremarkable'
Yogis over tradies? Building lobby slams draft skilled migration list

image.altText: A woman with dyed purple hair looks distressed. She is wearing a forest green blazer. Behind her, a man in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: With 200-plus films, Sydney Film Festival's line-up can be overwhelming. Our film critics offer nine must-sees.

title.children: Tilda Swinton at her most eccentric, First Nation folk horror and seven more must-sees at Sydney Film Festival

image.altText: Protesters hold signs, including one that says "Hostage Deal Now" and others in foreign script.

props.synopsis: Four more hostages kidnapped on October 7 are declared dead by the Israeli military â including three men seen in a Hamas video begging to be released.Â

title.children: Israel says hostages who appeared in Hamas video are now dead
